text: uh hi everyone clear with an ethroat
Tano here the internet's busiest music
nerd and it's time for a review of this
new slow dive album everything is alive
we are now two albums deep into one of
the most momentous comebacks in
underground rock and pop the
groundbreaking dream pop and shoegaze
outfit slow dive they're back they're
still back hitting us with a new record
after their self-titled LP in 2017 which
was their first record in over 20 years
at that point and frankly I thought it
was pretty unimpressive with a lot of
bland textures over saturated mixes and
one-dimensional songs this record didn't
really hold a candle to any of slow
Dives 90s releases in my opinion I do
highly recommend those 90s releases so I
wasn't crazy about the last record
however this wouldn't be the only time a
band has come through with a comeback
album that I thought was kind of rough
but they nailed it and ended up finding
their footing the next time around on
another project which was essential
actually my hope with everything is
alive a hope that was pretty dashed once
I heard the record and found there
wasn't a whole lot to go over now in
this records defense it does start
pretty strong with the song Shanty we
have some Eerie distant tones on this
track warm bass gentle drums absolutely
crispy fried Rhythm guitars that
actually do provide a pretty interesting
texture considering everything else
going on in the background and we have
some very steady analog synth work on
the track too all these elements meld
together pretty beautifully to make for
an experience that's equal parts
haunting and beautiful so yeah great way
to kick off the Record and frankly this
is a sound a Vibe I was hoping to hear
slow dive dive into further but the
magic on this record wears off pretty
quick with the song prayer remembered
which is a very mid and jangly post Rock
instrumental that sounds like a late era
explosions in the sky track that doesn't
go anywhere kind of shocking to hear a
track on this record with so few song
songs on it sound this underdeveloped
and basic and while the following a life
may see the band going back to their
dream pop Roots the track overall is
pretty standard for this genre in just
about every way the effects the vague
nondescript vocals the mix where
everything has kind of a soft and
rounded Edge to it it's hard to tell
whether or not the band is truly low on
ideas or maybe the ideas they forged
decades ago were so groundbreaking and
influential that they feel commonplace
now one thing I will say though is the
Aesthetics of this track in my opinion
are more Blissful and enchanting than
much of what was on the self-titled skin
in the games and other straight up dream
pop cut that hits in much the same way
while kisses has to be the best track in
this Lane mostly because of its much
more memorable Melody it's intelligible
vocals there's a stronger burst of
guitars on the chorus as well it's funny
how these small and little additions
tend to make a world of difference I did
like to hear the band switch things up
with something more raw and intimate and
acoustic on Andalusia plays though the
plainly strummed guitars plotting beats
and mumbly singing Do lack a bit of
finesse thankfully from here the record
goes into a pretty strong ending there's
chain to a cloud which hits a stride
with a hypnotic Groove ghostly lead
vocals and some mushy and thick layers
of guitars and scents that are pretty
enveloping and there's something
powerful about how it washes over even
if the chord progression is a little
basic then the closing track the slab
might be a little repetitive with its
chimey Rhythm guitars and pounding beats
but once again the Band hits upon this
amazing and monolithic sound that I
loved getting lost in plus the heavier
more distorted guitar passages and Lead
Melodies brought a kind of eerie and
ominous vibe to the whole thing but
whether the Vibes on these tracks are
alike to a warm embrace or a harsh
blizzard I just wish this record brought
more sounds to the table that felt like
I was just being swaddled in them
because I think that's where the album
shines brightest because the high point
on this thing is certainly not a
faceless post-rock instrumental that has
little to no progression to it overall I
thought the record was decent it was
listenable but again given slow Dives a
very amazing back catalog it is always
going to be disappointing to some extent
to hear a new project that doesn't go
quite as hard I'm feeling a light to
decent six on this one transition have
you given this album a listen did you
love it did you hate it what would you
rate it you're the best you're the best
what should I review next hit the like
if you like Please Subscribe and please
don't cry hit the Bell as well over here
next to my head it's another video you
can check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel Anthony fantano
slow dive forever
